page.title: 05A DERG FARMER'S DAY. 2.
page.content: What happens next is up to the farmers own discretion. If its dry there is fertiliser to be sown weeds to be sprayed. Field cultivations or conservation of winter feed may commence. If its wet then farm maintence or machinery repairs can take place instead there is always plenty to choose from. Come six pm. It is milking time again. This generally ends the farmer's day unless he wants to take full advantage of favourable weather conditions such as during harvesting or silage making.
